info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 3:42PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN SOCORRO COUNTY THROUGH 415 PM MDT... At 342 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of San Antonio, or 18 miles southeast of Socorro, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bingham. This includes Highway 380 between Mile Markers 3 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
